intro: Plagiobothrys jonesii, commonly known as Jones' bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and pungent odor. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is found in regions such as California and Nevada. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it has a short growing season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
